texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Much of my work at Red Hat revolves around the RHEL experience in public clouds. I thrive on input from customers, partners, and coworkers about how they consume public clouds and why they made decisions to deploy there.
texts.text: Much of my work at Red Hat revolves around the RHEL experience in public clouds. I thrive on input from customers, partners, and coworkers about how they consume public clouds and why they made decisions to deploy there.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Throughout this process, I run into some wild misconceptions about public clouds and what makes them useful. One that I hear most often is:
texts.text: Throughout this process, I run into some wild misconceptions about public clouds and what makes them useful. One that I hear most often is:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Businesses are moving to the cloud to reduce cost and improve efficiency. It's mainly just a purchasing exercise.
texts.text: Businesses are moving to the cloud to reduce cost and improve efficiency. It's mainly just a purchasing exercise.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: This couldn't be further from the truth.
texts.text: This couldn't be further from the truth.

texts.label: title
texts.orig: Cloud offers a chance to start over
texts.text: Cloud offers a chance to start over

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Sometimes businesses find themselves in an IT quagmire[^quagmire]. No matter what they do to improve their situation, it just gets worse. Capital expenditures grow and grow, datacenter space gets more expensive, and companies spend more time focusing on IT rather than their core business.
texts.text: Sometimes businesses find themselves in an IT quagmire[^quagmire]. No matter what they do to improve their situation, it just gets worse. Capital expenditures grow and grow, datacenter space gets more expensive, and companies spend more time focusing on IT rather than their core business.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Deploying in clouds offers that chance to break the capital expense cycle and gradually improve infrastructure. The key word here is  gradual .
texts.text: Deploying in clouds offers that chance to break the capital expense cycle and gradually improve infrastructure. The key word here is  gradual .

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Businesses can choose how much they want to deploy and when without worrying about expensive servers in the datacenter waiting to be used. Some deployments are greenfield, or entirely net new applications. Some are basic migrations of applications from servers or virtual machines directly to the cloud.
texts.text: Businesses can choose how much they want to deploy and when without worrying about expensive servers in the datacenter waiting to be used. Some deployments are greenfield, or entirely net new applications. Some are basic migrations of applications from servers or virtual machines directly to the cloud.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Either way, businesses have the freedom to deploy as little or as much as they want on their own schedule.
texts.text: Either way, businesses have the freedom to deploy as little or as much as they want on their own schedule.

texts.label: title
texts.orig: Cloud offers a chance to software-define (nearly) anything
texts.text: Cloud offers a chance to software-define (nearly) anything

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Anyone who has worked in a large organization before knows the pain of change management. Sure, it ticks a box on that yearly compliance program, but it also ensures that everyone is aligned on the plan.
texts.text: Anyone who has worked in a large organization before knows the pain of change management. Sure, it ticks a box on that yearly compliance program, but it also ensures that everyone is aligned on the plan.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: One of the greatest aspects of cloud is that you can define almost everything in software. This makes changes easier to apply, easier to roll back, and easier to track.
texts.text: One of the greatest aspects of cloud is that you can define almost everything in software. This makes changes easier to apply, easier to roll back, and easier to track.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Tools like  Terraform  or  Ansible  allow developers and operations team to work from the same playbook. My team enjoys using  Infracost  to track how much a particular Terraform change might cost us under different scenarios.
texts.text: Tools like  Terraform  or  Ansible  allow developers and operations team to work from the same playbook. My team enjoys using  Infracost  to track how much a particular Terraform change might cost us under different scenarios.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Once teams set a policy of "we define our changes in git, and that's it", you can rely on a git history for change management. This avoids drift in production environments and it also ensures that changes made in development environments make it into staging and then into production. The days of  "it worked on my system, what's wrong with production?"  slowly fade away.
texts.text: Once teams set a policy of "we define our changes in git, and that's it", you can rely on a git history for change management. This avoids drift in production environments and it also ensures that changes made in development environments make it into staging and then into production. The days of  "it worked on my system, what's wrong with production?"  slowly fade away.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Less than ideal architectural decisions can also be adjusted over time to fit the applications being deployed. Did you set up a network incorrectly? Did you choose an instance type without enough RAM?
texts.text: Less than ideal architectural decisions can also be adjusted over time to fit the applications being deployed. Did you set up a network incorrectly? Did you choose an instance type without enough RAM?

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: That's okay!
texts.text: That's okay!

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Just adjust the deployment in git, test it in staging, and push it to production.
texts.text: Just adjust the deployment in git, test it in staging, and push it to production.

texts.label: title
texts.orig: Cloud offers managed services
texts.text: Cloud offers managed services

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: One thing I tell people constantly is that if you bend the cloud to fit your application,  you will almost always pay more. You get cost and performance efficiencies if you bend your application to fit the cloud. Confused? I'll explain.
texts.text: One thing I tell people constantly is that if you bend the cloud to fit your application,  you will almost always pay more. You get cost and performance efficiencies if you bend your application to fit the cloud. Confused? I'll explain.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: When I talk to people doing their first cloud deployments, they deploy everything into VMs, much as they would in a local virtualized environment.
texts.text: When I talk to people doing their first cloud deployments, they deploy everything into VMs, much as they would in a local virtualized environment.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Most public clouds offer tons of services that lift the management burden from engineering teams and offload into a managed service. For example, that cron job might be able to move into a "serverless"[^serverless] service, such as  AWS Lambda . It's critical to check the pricing here to ensure you're not headed down a bad path, but you have one less VM to maintain, one less IPv4 address to pay for, and a greatly reduced risk of configuration drift. That reduction in stress and risk might be worth any additional costs.
texts.text: Most public clouds offer tons of services that lift the management burden from engineering teams and offload into a managed service. For example, that cron job might be able to move into a "serverless"[^serverless] service, such as  AWS Lambda . It's critical to check the pricing here to ensure you're not headed down a bad path, but you have one less VM to maintain, one less IPv4 address to pay for, and a greatly reduced risk of configuration drift. That reduction in stress and risk might be worth any additional costs.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Deployment decisions become much easier and lower stress when you consume services offered by the provider. There are those situations where deploying a whole VM is needed, but I've managed to avoid that for some of my team's recent deployments.
texts.text: Deployment decisions become much easier and lower stress when you consume services offered by the provider. There are those situations where deploying a whole VM is needed, but I've managed to avoid that for some of my team's recent deployments.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Our last deployment uses GitHub Actions, S3, and CloudFront and costs us about $6.50 per month to run. There are no virtual machines. There's nothing to patch.
texts.text: Our last deployment uses GitHub Actions, S3, and CloudFront and costs us about $6.50 per month to run. There are no virtual machines. There's nothing to patch.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: This blog  runs on a similar stack  and costs me about $0.25 per month to run.
texts.text: This blog  runs on a similar stack  and costs me about $0.25 per month to run.

texts.label: title
texts.orig: Cloud offers geographic distribution
texts.text: Cloud offers geographic distribution

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Nearly every public cloud, even the smallest ones, offer you the same or similar services in a wide variety of geographic regions. Disaster recovery feels more attainable when you can easily deploy to multiple regions with the same software-defined infrastructure.
texts.text: Nearly every public cloud, even the smallest ones, offer you the same or similar services in a wide variety of geographic regions. Disaster recovery feels more attainable when you can easily deploy to multiple regions with the same software-defined infrastructure.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Data sovereignty continues to grow in importance around the world as more countries demand that their data remains within their borders. As long as your cloud offers a region in that country, you can deploy there. There's no challenging legal issues with finding datacenter space or getting hardware delivered. You just change your region and deploy.
texts.text: Data sovereignty continues to grow in importance around the world as more countries demand that their data remains within their borders. As long as your cloud offers a region in that country, you can deploy there. There's no challenging legal issues with finding datacenter space or getting hardware delivered. You just change your region and deploy.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Cloud regions also allow you to bring your applications much closer to the people who use them. Reduced latency delivers content faster to customers and provides a responsive experience.
texts.text: Cloud regions also allow you to bring your applications much closer to the people who use them. Reduced latency delivers content faster to customers and provides a responsive experience.

texts.label: title
texts.orig: Clouds offer purchasing efficiency
texts.text: Clouds offer purchasing efficiency

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Wait a minute! Didn't I say that moving to cloud isn't just a purchasing exercise? 🤔
texts.text: Wait a minute! Didn't I say that moving to cloud isn't just a purchasing exercise? 🤔

texts.label: paragraph

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Your move to cloud should not be solely based on cutting costs or making purchasing IT more efficient. Most teams find that moving to cloud is more expensive than they anticipated because they're finally able to get access to the right amount of resources that they need. (Also, they usually go with some more expensive options up front until they figure out how to optimize for cost.)
texts.text: Your move to cloud should not be solely based on cutting costs or making purchasing IT more efficient. Most teams find that moving to cloud is more expensive than they anticipated because they're finally able to get access to the right amount of resources that they need. (Also, they usually go with some more expensive options up front until they figure out how to optimize for cost.)

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: First off, it's much easier to budget and pay one vendor for multiple services than deal with multiple independent vendors. Instead of paying for datacenter space, then paying for servers, then paying for network equipment, then paying for people to set it up, and so on, you pay the cloud provider for all of it.
texts.text: First off, it's much easier to budget and pay one vendor for multiple services than deal with multiple independent vendors. Instead of paying for datacenter space, then paying for servers, then paying for network equipment, then paying for people to set it up, and so on, you pay the cloud provider for all of it.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: This also extends to other purchases on the cloud, such as products from certain vendors. For example, you can buy Red Hat products directly from some cloud providers and that gets added onto your cloud invoice. You can even deploy your own  Cisco ASA in the cloud  if you feel so inclined.
texts.text: This also extends to other purchases on the cloud, such as products from certain vendors. For example, you can buy Red Hat products directly from some cloud providers and that gets added onto your cloud invoice. You can even deploy your own  Cisco ASA in the cloud  if you feel so inclined.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: With all of these purchases going through one vendor, you can also negotiate discounts if you set a spending commitment. Discounts depend on your committed spend, of course, and the term that you agree to spend it. There's a whole industry around financial operations in the cloud, called  FinOps , and this is one of many things that factors into it.
texts.text: With all of these purchases going through one vendor, you can also negotiate discounts if you set a spending commitment. Discounts depend on your committed spend, of course, and the term that you agree to spend it. There's a whole industry around financial operations in the cloud, called  FinOps , and this is one of many things that factors into it.

texts.orig: Wrapping up
texts.text: Wrapping up

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Public clouds offer an incredible amount of opportunity to get your IT deployments into better shape with better change control and a solid software-defined workflow. They also offer the ability to "write one check" to consume infrastructure via utility billing.
texts.text: Public clouds offer an incredible amount of opportunity to get your IT deployments into better shape with better change control and a solid software-defined workflow. They also offer the ability to "write one check" to consume infrastructure via utility billing.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: However, public clouds are not ideal for every application or situation.
texts.text: However, public clouds are not ideal for every application or situation.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Do I think that  every company  in the world could benefit from getting some part of their IT deployments into a public cloud platform? Yes, I do.
texts.text: Do I think that  every company  in the world could benefit from getting some part of their IT deployments into a public cloud platform? Yes, I do.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Would  every company  benefit from putting most of their infrastructure into public clouds? Very unlikely.
texts.text: Would  every company  benefit from putting most of their infrastructure into public clouds? Very unlikely.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Some applications still benefit from being on purpose-built hardware or in certain locations where a cloud might not exist today. Clouds can also be extremely expensive if you run large workloads around the clock. They can also be painful for applications with very strict or special requirements that don't fit a cloud deployment model well.
texts.text: Some applications still benefit from being on purpose-built hardware or in certain locations where a cloud might not exist today. Clouds can also be extremely expensive if you run large workloads around the clock. They can also be painful for applications with very strict or special requirements that don't fit a cloud deployment model well.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The vendors that will succeed the most in the cloud space are the ones that look beyond purchasing efficiencies and IT acquisition concerns. Simply dragging the old world of physical servers or virtual machines into cloud won't lead anywhere.
texts.text: The vendors that will succeed the most in the cloud space are the ones that look beyond purchasing efficiencies and IT acquisition concerns. Simply dragging the old world of physical servers or virtual machines into cloud won't lead anywhere.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Those companies that help their customers  benefit from the best of what public clouds have to offer  in the most secure, reliable, and simple ways will be in the driver's seat.
texts.text: Those companies that help their customers  benefit from the best of what public clouds have to offer  in the most secure, reliable, and simple ways will be in the driver's seat.
